description: Drives the achievement of sales results through the establishment of a sales strategy. Demonstrates the added value of the organisation's products and services to new or existing customers and prospects. Establishes a sales support procedure providing efficient response to sales enquiries, consistent with company strategy and policy. Establishes a systematic approach to the entire sales process, including understanding customer needs, forecasting, prospect evaluation, negotiation tactics and sales closure
title: Sales Management

levels.3: Contributes to the sales process by effectively presenting products or services to customers.
levels.4: Assesses and estimates appropriate sales strategies to deliver company results. Decides and allocates annual sales targets and adjusts incentives to meet market conditions.
levels.5: Assumes ultimate responsibility for the sales performance of the organisation. Authorises resource allocation, prioritises product and service promotions, advises board directors of sales performance.

knowledges.K1: customer organisation (needs, budget allocation and decision makers)
knowledges.K3: market trends and own service offering portfolio
knowledges.K6: current market imperatives e.g. risks, changes, innovation

skills.S3: react proactively to customer business changes and communicate them internally
skills.S5: analyse sales performance to build forecasts and develop a tactical sales plan
skills.S1: develop strong co-operation between customers and own organisation
skills.S2: keep abreast of market news e.g. risks, changes, innovations and communicate to internal business units, to improve service and product portfolio
